org.openadaptor.core.router
Class Router

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.router.AbstractRouter
          org.openadaptor.core.router.Router
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, ILifecycleComponentContainer, IMessageProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Pipeline
public class Router
extends AbstractRouter
implements IMessageProcessor

An IMessageProcessor implementation that uses an IRoutingMap to process a message by calling a sequence of IMessageProcessors.

Author:
perryj
See Also:
IRoutingMap

Method Detail

getRoutingMap

public RoutingMap getRoutingMap()
Public accessor: intended for read-only use (returns a clone).

Overrides:
getRoutingMap in class AbstractRouter

setProcessMap

public void setProcessMap(java.util.Map map)
Sets the processMap which defines how to route output from one adaptor component to anothers. The keys must be IMessageProcessors and the values Lists of IMessageProcessors. However this setter will do a fair amount of autoboxing to make the caller's life slightly easier. Non list values will automatically be boxed into a list. Key which are not actually IMessageProcessors but are Connectors or Processors will be automatically boxed in a Node. There is a default Autoboxer but this can be overriden.

Parameters:
map -
See Also:
IMessageProcessor, Node

setDiscardMap

public void setDiscardMap(java.util.Map map)
Sets the discardMap which defines how to route discarded input from one adaptor component to anothers. The keys must be IMessageProcessors and the values Lists of IMessageProcessors. However this setter will do a fair amount of autoboxing to make the caller's life slightly easier. Non list values will automatically be boxed into a list. Key which are not actually IMessageProcessors but are Connectors or Processors will be automatically boxed in a Node. There is a default Autoboxer but this can be overriden.

Parameters:
map -
See Also:
IMessageProcessor, Node

setProcessors

public void setProcessors(java.util.List processorList)
Shorthand for configuring a list of processors to be connected in sequence.
This simply creates a Map with a series of entries of the form processor[n]->processor[n+1] Then it calls setProcessMap(Map) with the generated Map.

Parameters:
processorList -

setExceptionProcessor

public void setExceptionProcessor(java.lang.Object exceptionProcessor)
This allows configuration of a single 'catch-all' processor for exceptions.

Populates the exceptionMap on the RoutingMap with either the custom exceptionMap from the IExceptionHandler (if found) or the default exceptinList.

Parameters:
exceptionProcessor - this can be any of:
  • IDataProcessor
  • IWriteConnector
  • IExceptionHandler
See Also:
IExceptionHandler.setExceptionMap(Map)
